text: are one of the basic local entities of Japan.Web-Japan.org, "Local self- government," p. 1; retrieved 2012-12-19. There are 23 municipalities in the core of the capital of Japan.Tokyo Metropolitan Government (TMG), "Municipalities within Tokyo" ; retrieved 2012-3-26. They are "special wards" because they are different from the of other major Japanese cities.The special wards are not the same as the special cities of Japan. ==History== In 1889, 15 wards were established in the city of Tokyo. The number of wards grew to 35 in 1932. The number of wards became 23 in 1947. The traditional districts of Tokyo evolved as the city grew during the Edo period. There are many districts in Tokyo's special wards. ==List of special wards== Name Kanji Population (2007) Density Area Major districts Adachi Adachi website ; retrieved 2012-3-26. 足立区 629,392
